title: For Sale/Trade:  SIG P229 - 357 - SPORT STAINLESS COMPETITION (3-10 ROUND MAGS)
postcontent:
AS NEW RARE P229-357-SPORT ( or P229S ) pistol with three 10 ROUND factory magazines, CUSTOM LEATHER HOLSTER and 900 ROUNDS 357 SIG AMMO. 
This pistol has been fired less than 50 rounds and has been a SAFE QUEEN for over 12 years and is both cosmetically and mechanically in perfect condition. IT IS A TACK DRIVER and Given its rarity, 100% stainless steel construction, threaded barrel and pure German lineage the P229S is a terrific acquisition for the advanced SIG collector. 

The SIG P229S competition pistol was first introduced in 1998. It was not continuously manufactured and only a relatively small number were made. The P229S was permanently discontinued in 2005. Every SIG P229S pistol was assembled by a dedicated technician at the SIG SAUER facilities in Germany. Each pistol was hand fitted and hand tuned to ensure smooth operation and the kind of superior accuracy you would expect from a SIG target grade pistol. SIG P229 Sport pistols are rigorously tested beyond normal limits and adjusted to ensure the very highest levels of performance. 

All SIG P229S pistols were assembled with a heavy contour target type barrel, precision machined stainless steel slide and stainless steel frame. The heavy stainless steel adds significant weight and rigidity to the platform thus reducing felt recoil and improving control. The P229S also employs a unique proprietary muzzle brake with an expansion chamber to soften recoil and help prevent muzzle rise, further improving on-target accuracy for second and subsequent shots. 

Based on the extensively combat tested P229 frame, the P229S pistol features; a stainless steel slide and frame, heavy match THREADED barrel, unique detachable combination vented muzzle compensator and counter weight, fully adjustable low-profile target sights, wrap around semi-soft Hogue rubber grips, grooved front strap, competition extended controls ( magazine release, de-cocking lever and slide release ), reversible magazine release, patented four point safety system, unique magazines with blue body and aluminum base plate with finger extension, factory tuned target trigger and squared trigger guard with grooved front strap. 

SIG P229S MODEL #229-357-SPORT SPECIFICATIONS 

Barrel length - 4.8” 

Caliber - .357 SIG 

Finish – matte stainless steel 

Grips – black semi-soft rubber w/ pebble texture 

Height – overall - 5.7” 

Length – overall - 8.6” 

Magazine – 10 round w/ aluminum base plate finger extension 

Operation – mechanically locked, recoil operated 

Rifling grooves - 6 

Rifling twist – 1 in 16.0” 

Safety – 4 point system including patented automatic firing pin lock 

Sights – target adjustable 

Sight radius - 6.9” 

Trigger – double action/single action or double action 

Trigger guard – squared style 

Trigger pull – DA 10lbs / SA 4.5lbs. 

Weight w/ magazine – 43.6oz. 

Width – overall - 1.5”

title: For Sale:  Talon Grips Rubberized for Glock
postcontent:
With the ever so popular deep concealment & single stacked polymer guns one questions keeps coming up.  How do I maintain a stable grip? Even with a full size firearm if you have shot any number of rounds through one you will notice as any moisture accumulates on your hands or in bad weather conditions it is harder to maintain that stable grip.  Under recoil you notice your hands starts separating, the gun starts shifting and we find ourselves readjusting our grip to maintain proper recoil control for follow up shots.  Whether you are a competitor, Military, LE or just the average Joe taking personal responsibility for your own safety you will find that with the Talon Rubberized Gun Grips you will be able to maintain a better grip which will give better control over your firearm.

Model 10 - Series 8 Police Shotgun. Has some wear and tear from duty but in great condition for it's age. 2 3/4" Shells - High Brass or magnum.

These guns were designed and developed by a Santa Monica, California police sargent named Alfred Crouch, for use as a SWAT tactical firearm. In the mid 1960s Crouch sold his design to High Standard who used their Flight King shotgun as the platform for the product. In the late 60s and in the 70s these guns were sold to many police departments and some foreign militaries. The compact size, manuverability and ability to use with one hand make these a formidable self-defense weapon. title: For Sale:  Black Friday priced Bushmaster A3 Patrolman AR-15 (1 left)!  NIB w/lifetime warranty
postcontent:
The M4-Type Patrolman's Carbine is one of Bushmaster's most popular carbines, and it's great for 3-gun match shooting, home defense, and law enforcement use. It features a six-position telestock and a 16" barrel with a threaded A2 birdcage flash suppressor (for a total length of 17.25"). The bore and chamber of the barrel are chrome-lined for ease of cleaning and longevity, and the carbine has a Mil-Spec manganese phosphate outer coating that protects the barrel and critical steel components from corrosion and rust. The upper receiver is offered in A2 and A3 configurations. The A2 upper receiver (SSI 13231) has a 300-800 meter rear sight system with 1 MOA elevation and 1/2 MOA windage adjustments. The A3 upper receiver (SSI 13230, 84824) features a Picatinny rail, a removable carry handle, and a 300-600 meter rear sight system with 1/2 MOA elevation and windage adjustments. The carbine ships with a magazine, an operator safety manual, a chamber flag, and a sling.

Only 1 left at this price!!

title: For Sale:  cz vzor 50 collector quality !
location: Union MO franklin county, St. Louis, Missouri
postcontent:
I dont know alot about this gun but this what i have been told and found ! It is a pre 1957 CZ 50 which shoot 7.65 ammo this gun must have been restored because it looks SUPERB ! It has an 8 round magazine and i have been told all models with a 6 digit serial number are pre 57 CHECK FOR YOURSELF ! I FOUND THIS ARTICLE !!
Early production CZ vzor 50s will have 6-digit serial numbers. They will also bear the manufacture marks CESKA ZBROJOVKA on the top line and a lower line of NAR. PODNIK STRAKONICE on the left slide. Call or text REDACTED Bill of sale will be provided 

The "Nar Podnik" stamp denotes CZ as having become a "Narodni Ponik" which is, essentially, a unified "National Enterprise." These National Enterprises were the sole manufacturers of certain goods under the Soviet-style economy. As CZ became a collectivized industry consolidatingthe production of firearms under a single state entity at Uhersky Brod, so Ceske Zavody Motocyklove Narodni Podnik (Czech Motorcycle Works, National Enterprise) became the sole manufacturers of Czech motorcycles at the old arms plant in Strakonice.

title: For Sale:  AR-15 with upgrades
postcontent:
For sale $1050 cash only..not interested in trades of firearms or other products (sorry). 
This is a beautiful AR15 built with top notch parts.  It functions perfectly and has only had 30 rounds put through it .  Specs/parts as follows:
Barrel: .223/5.56 spiral fluted 416 stainless steel H Bar 16” match barrel with 1:9 twist rate and .223 Wylde chamber and M4 feed ramps.
Flash suppressor/compensator:  Titan JP Michlek style stainless steel muzzle break and carbine length gas system. It stays right on target for your next shot.
Syrac Arms Gen II adjustable gas block.  This is a self locking “notched” adjuster type gas block and the newest one on the market.  No separate detent to hold down, no thread locking sealant required to keep it in position and only one hand needed to adjust it from the front.  The AR15 platform is known for being overgassed and this allows you to reduce the amount of pressure going to your bolt carrier if you choose to turn it down . 
CTS carbon fiber free float fore end/quad rail 9 ½” long
Anderson 7075 lower with colored pictograms and manufacturer highlights as well as an Anderson lower parts kit.
Nickel Teflon treated upper with dust cover door and forward assist.  This is some of the newest technology out for these black rifles.  Per the manufacturer this needs no lube and is good for 40,000 – 50,000 rounds without lubrication.  I lube it anyway…it can’t hurt.  It makes it real easy to clean too compared to anodized uppers.  
Nickel boron bolt carrier assembly.  Again…the newest technology parts.  Combined with the nickel Teflon treated upper it is a no lubrication needed assembly if you do not like to deal with lubricants.  Carbon cleans off it easily compared to anodized bolts. 
Site Mark adjustable red reflex sight
6 position adjustable stock. 
One Magpul 30 round magazine with 20 rounds of Wolf gold .223 ammo included. 
Located in Macomb Township near M59 and I94.

title: For Sale:  Talon Grips Rubberized for Ruger
postcontent:
With the ever so popular deep concealment & single stacked polymer guns one questions keeps coming up.  How do I maintain a stable grip? Even with a full size firearm if you have shot any number of rounds through one you will notice as any moisture accumulates on your hands or in bad weather conditions it is harder to maintain that stable grip.  Under recoil you notice your hands starts separating, the gun starts shifting and we find ourselves readjusting our grip to maintain proper recoil control for follow up shots.  Whether you are a competitor, Military, LE or just the average Joe taking personal responsibility for your own safety you will find that with the Talon Rubberized Gun Grips you will be able to maintain a better grip which will give better control over your firearm.

SR9c, SR40c, LC9s

title: For Sale:  CIVIL WAR MODEL 1860
postcontent: This Spencer .52 caliber carbine is 100% in its original Civil War configuration. This carbine is a fine example of the 1st Model Spencer seven-shot carbine without any of the modifications that were added later in the war. The US government contracted for a total of over 95,000 Spencer carbines during the war with 65,000 made at Spencer’s Boston, MA factory and 30,000 of the weapons made at the Burnside Rifle Company in Rhode Island. This Fine carbine is serial #579XX. Has an 22" barrel with six grooves. The bore is excellent with crisp lands and grooves. The barrel has about 75-80% thinning blue left. There are scattered Inspector marks on the metal parts along with the Number 19 stamped on the loading block and loading tube and other major components. I believe this may be issue numbers for a State Cavalry Unit. Traces of case color on the receiver remain. The beautiful walnut stock and forend are excellent and have not been refinished. There is no stock cartouche nor was there ever one. The stock shows virtually no wear, just some handling marks. One small sliver on the forend has been repaired. The metal is a tight smooth fit wear it meets the wood, no gaps. Sling ring bar on the left side has never been off. The original steel loading tube is in excellent undented condition. Spring is strong and fits tightly in the shoulder stock. Top flat on the receiver,

The Springfield Model 1892-99 Krag-Jorgensen rifle is a Norwegian-design bolt action rifle that was adopted in 1892 as the standard United States Army military longarm, chambered in U.S. caliber .30-40 Krag. The U.S. Krag was replaced beginning in 1903 with the introduction of the M1903 Springfield rifle.

title: For Sale:  Kel-Tec KSG With Free Shipping
postcontent: Kel-Tec KSGBLK 12GA Tactical Shotgun 14rd. MSRP:$1090.91. The KSG (Kel-Tec Shotgun) is Kel-Tec CNC’s first entry into the shotgun market. The size, shape, and design is similar to the currently available Kel-Tec RFB rifle, but the KSG ejects downward, instead of forward. The KSG weighs 6.9 lbs. and is as compact as legally possible with a 26.1” overall length and an 18.5” cylinder bore barrel. Even with this compact size, the internal dual tube magazines hold an impressive 14 rounds of 12 gauge 2.75” rounds in total (7 per tube). It can also reliably shoot shells as short as 1 3/4" up to the 2.75". This simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard. The pump includes an under picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, a light, or a laser. The included top picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil. The KSG receiver is made from hardened steel and includes the magazine tubes which have been welded in place. The grip and stock assembly is made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel) and is easily disassembled by pushing out 2 pins, which store in 2 holes in the grip when removed. The barrel and pump assembly is removed by loosening the 2 front magazine tube nuts with a coin and sliding the assembly forward. Features. 12 Gauge. 2.75" Chamber. 14 Round Capacity. 6.9 lbs. title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer 1911 RCS
location: St Louis Area (can travel), St. Louis, Missouri
postcontent:
For sale is a Sig 1911 4.2" RCS, with accessories. It is only very slightly used, still in original box with all original documents. Included with the purchase I have the following:

 1) G-Code OWB holster and G-Code double mag carrier (both Kydex/nylon)
 2) Aliengear IWB holster (http://aliengearholsters.com/)
 3) Wilson Combat 1911 magazines, 3 of them. These are widely regarded as the best aftermarket 1911 magazines out there (http://www.brownells.com/magazines/handgun-magazines/magazines/1911-officer-45acp-wilson-rogers-magazines-prod71718.aspx).

Info about the pistol: "The 1911 Compact RCS is quite possibly the quintessential concealed carry 1911. The RCS comes from the SIG SAUER Custom Shop and has been put through the SIG Anti-Snag treatment which our gunsmiths developed to radically dehorn a pistol. The RCS comes with low profile night sights, checkered front strap (25-lpi), checkered mainspring housing (20-lpi) and slim profile grips. Each of these 7+1 capacity RCS model 1911 pistols feature a stainless steel slide, alloy frame, match grade barrel, hammer/sear set and trigger. The slides and frames are machined to exacting tolerances and hand-fitted to insure reliability and performance."

It has a 4.2" barrel similar to a Colt Commander 1911. As mentioned in the manufacturer blurb above, it has night sights already on it. It will accept either 7 or 8 round magazines (which you probably already know if you're looking for a 1911). It came with 2 Sig magazines, so you would get 5 magazines total including the 3 Wilson Combat mags. The pistol and the mags are worth $550, so the holsters are essentially being thrown in for free. The gun shoots perfectly, has tight fitment, and is very easy to carry.

title: For Sale:  REMINGTON ROLLING BLOCK
postcontent: From my personal collection, a very early Remington rolling block rifle with features only present on the first 600 or so "series 1870" rifles produced. According to Marcot's excellent reference book, this rifle is part of a very small number of sporting rifles made up from military receivers with round tops. This round top variation ended at around serial number 1400. These are early variations/forerunners to the #1 rolling block sporting rifle for which Remington became famous. Related early features are the long lower tang that extends well beyond the upper tang, no barrel markings or externally marked serial number, earliest military-type patent markings on the upper tang, rounded receiver pins (instead of flat on the right side of the receiver), hand filed thumb piece and shield impressed hammer typical of this early serial range, early "4th type" Series 1870 buttplate with a distinct antique "kentucky rifle" design, and finally a heavy military type trigger guard only found on these very scarce early guns. In addition to those features, it has two features that are unique to approximately the first 600 rifles produced. First, it has the earliest plain smooth/rounded contour forend cap. Guns after this serial range have a distinct schnabel contour. Second, it has the very early "dished" breech block (see photo #34), that was eliminated by Remington some time after serial number 588 according to Marcot, and no longer dished. Other interesting features include a sight setup that Remington called "extra sights" - a Remington "combination" rear barrel mounted sight and combination Beach front sight. At some point during period of use, someone removed the rear combination barrel sight and replaced it with an early Remington sporting type sight with elevator, but the Beach sight is still intact and functional. It also has a set trigger, which became available sometime after serial number 200 according to Marcot, and is in caliber 38 Long Rimfire (these early guns were only manufactured in rimfire calibers). The serial number is only stamped internally on these early guns, under the forend on the barrel, and on the face of the stock typically. Due to a buggered forend screw (the one bad screw on the whole gun...), I was not able to remove the forend, but the serial number 503 is clear on the face of the stock, as are the early upper and lower tang assembly numbers used in this serial range. This gun came from an old time collection and had not seen the light of day for decades, and is completely untouched. Based on that and the definitive under-600 serial number range features, I will guarantee the new owner that the number under the forend will match if the forend can ever be removed. Condition is untouched, there is no doubt I am the first person to remove the buttstock from the rifle in a very long time. Bore is quite nice, especially for a working gun from the early 1870s, with some roughness in the first 8" or so, but strong rifling. Remainder of the bore is bright and shiny with very strong lands/grooves. Mechanical function seems perfect, other than the set trigger appears to need a good cleaning - it wants to set, but slips back into the standard cocked position.
